thread.title: PAINFULLY predictable PETA has SQUEE-fest, tries to take credit for ending Ringling Brothers Circus
thread.title_full: PAINFULLY predictable PETA has SQUEE-fest, tries to take credit for ending Ringling Brothers Circus

author: Sam J.
title: PAINFULLY predictable PETA has SQUEE-fest, tries to take credit for ending Ringling Brothers Circus
text:
Saddest show on Earth, really? Perhaps they should take a look at the ‘show’ over at Planned Parenthood. @peta um, it's "greatest". 
— justaguy (@JMurray247) January 15, 2017 
And it always will be. @peta don't be proud; 10 million circus customers, 400 circus employees and thousands more venue workers are the losers here 
— Stephen Flatow (@smflatow) January 15, 2017 
Oh but the millions of people out of work don’t matter ya’ know, nor do the animals who have it better than a lot of people … their AGENDA supposedly won. YIPPEE! That’s all that matters to them. PETA is asking all other animal circuses to follow suit, as this is a sign of changing times. 
— PETA (@peta) January 15, 2017 
They’re not wrong about changing times, except the times aren’t changing for the reasons they’re implying. 
Fewer people are attending the circus and other events like it because of devices, the internet, other options where they can witness the greatest show on Earth from their homes. Not because PETA covered some posters in glitter and made up pithy chants about the animals. 
C’mon, PETA may be annoying but when it comes to actually accomplishing anything, meh.
